memberdef.argsstring: (Param XParam, Forcing< float > XForcing, Model< T > XModel, Model< T > XModel_g)
memberdef.name: Testing

briefdescription.para: Wrapping function for all the inbuilt test This function is the entry point to other function below.

detaileddescription.para: Test 0 is a gausian hump propagating on a flat uniorm cartesian mesh (both GPU and CPU version tested) Test 1 is vertical discharge on a flat uniorm cartesian mesh (GPU or CPU version) Test 2 Gaussian wave on Cartesian grid (same as test 0): CPU vs GPU (GPU required) Test 3 Test Reduction algorithm Test 4 Boundary condition test Test 5 Lake at rest test for Ardusse/kurganov reconstruction/scheme Test 6 Mass conservation on a slope Test 7 Mass conservation with rain fall on grid Test 8 Rain Map forcing (comparison map and Time Serie and test case with slope and non-uniform rain map) Test 9 Zoned output (test zoned outputs with adaptative grid) Test 10 Initial Loss / Continuous Loss on a slope, under uniform rain Test 11 Wet/dry Instability test with Conserve Elevation Test 12 Calendar time to second conversion Test 13 Multi bathy and roughness map input Test 14 Test AOI bnds aswall to start with Test 15 Flexible times reading
Test 99 Run all the test with test number < 99.

The following test are not independant, they are tools to check or debug a personnal case Test 998 Compare resuts between the CPU and GPU Flow functions (GPU required) Test 999 Run the main loop and engine in debug mode

simplesect.para: true if all the tests passed

memberdef.argsstring: (Param XParam, Forcing< float > XForcing, Model< float > XModel, Model< float > XModel_g)
memberdef.name: Testing< float >

memberdef.argsstring: (Param XParam, Forcing< float > XForcing, Model< double > XModel, Model< double > XModel_g)
memberdef.name: Testing< double >

memberdef.argsstring: (T zsnit, int gpu, bool compare)
memberdef.name: GaussianHumptest

briefdescription.para: Gaussian hump propagation test.

detaileddescription.para:
This function tests the full hydrodynamics model and compares the results with pre-conmputed (Hard wired) values The function creates it own model setup and mesh independantly to what the user might want to do The setup consist of a centrally located gaussian hump radiating away The test stops at an arbitrary time to compare with 8 values extracted from a identical run in basilisk This function also compares the result of the GPU and CPU code (until they diverge)
zsnit
Initial water surface elevation at the centre of the domain
gpu
GPU device number to use (-1 for CPU only)
compare
If true, compare GPU and CPU results (GPU required)
true if the test passed (results within 1e-6 of reference values)

memberdef.argsstring: (float zsnit, int gpu, bool compare)
memberdef.name: GaussianHumptest< float >

memberdef.argsstring: (double zsnit, int gpu, bool compare)
memberdef.name: GaussianHumptest< double >

memberdef.argsstring: (T zsnit, int gpu)
memberdef.name: Rivertest

briefdescription.para: River inflow mass conservation test.

detaileddescription.para:
This function tests the mass conservation of the vertical injection (used for rivers) The function creates it own model setup and mesh independantly to what the user might want to do This starts with a initial water level (zsnit=0 is dry) and runs for 0.1s before comparing results with zsnit=0.1 that is approx 20 steps
zsnit
Initial water surface elevation at the centre of the domain
gpu
GPU device number to use (-1 for CPU only)
true if the test is successful (mass is conserved within 0.1% of the theoretical value)

memberdef.argsstring: (float zsnit, int gpu)
memberdef.name: Rivertest< float >

memberdef.argsstring: (double zsnit, int gpu)
memberdef.name: Rivertest< double >

memberdef.argsstring: (T zsnit, int gpu)
memberdef.name: MassConserveSteepSlope

briefdescription.para: River inflow mass conservation test on steep slope.

detaileddescription.para:
This function tests the mass conservation of the vertical injection (used for rivers) The function creates it own model setup and mesh independantly to what the user might want to do This starts with a initial water level (zsnit=0 is dry) and runs for 0.1s before comparing results with zsnit=0.1 that is approx 20 steps
zsnit
Initial water surface elevation at the centre of the domain
gpu
GPU device number to use (-1 for CPU only)
true if the test passed (mass conservation within 5%)

memberdef.argsstring: (float zsnit, int gpu)
memberdef.name: MassConserveSteepSlope< float >

memberdef.argsstring: (double zsnit, int gpu)
memberdef.name: MassConserveSteepSlope< double >

briefdescription.para: create V shape Valley basin

detaileddescription.para: This function creates a simple V shape Valley basin

parameterdescription.para: x coordinate of the valley center

simplesect.para: the depth of the basin at point (x,y)

memberdef.name: ThackerBathy

briefdescription.para: create a parabolic bassin

detaileddescription.para: This function creates a parabolic bassin. The function returns a single value of the bassin
Borrowed from Buttinger et al. 2019.

sect3.title: Reference
sect3.para:
Buttinger-Kreuzhuber, A., Horvth, Z., Noelle, S., Blschl, G., and Waser, J.: A fast second-order shallow water scheme on two-dimensional structured grids over abrupt topography, Advances in water resources, 127, 89108, 2019.
x
x coordinate
y
y coordinate
L
characteristic length scale of the bassin
D
characteristic depth of the bassin
the depth of the basin at point (x,y)

memberdef.argsstring: (Param XParam, T zsinit)
memberdef.name: ThackerLakeAtRest

briefdescription.para: Simulate the Lake-at-rest in a parabolic bassin.

detaileddescription.para: This function creates a parabolic bassin filled to a given level and run the modle for a while and checks that the velocities in the lake remain very small thus verifying the well-balancedness of teh engine and the Lake-at-rest condition.
Borrowed from Buttinger et al. 2019.

sect3.title: Reference
sect3.para:
Buttinger-Kreuzhuber, A., Horvth, Z., Noelle, S., Blschl, G., and Waser, J.: A fast second-order shallow water scheme on two-dimensional structured grids over abrupt topography, Advances in water resources, 127, 89108, 2019.
XParam
Model parameters
zsinit
initial water surface elevation
true if test passed

memberdef.argsstring: (Param XParam, float zsinit)
memberdef.name: ThackerLakeAtRest< float >

memberdef.argsstring: (Param XParam, double zsinit)
memberdef.name: ThackerLakeAtRest< double >

memberdef.name: RiverVolumeAdapt

memberdef.argsstring: (Param XParam, T slope, bool bottop, bool flip)
memberdef.name: RiverVolumeAdapt

briefdescription.para: Simulate a river flowing in a steep valley and heck the Volume conservation.

detaileddescription.para: This function creates a dry steep valley topography to a given level and run the model for a while and checks that the Volume matches the theory.

The function inherits the adaptation set in XParam so needs to be rerun to account for the different scenarios:
uniform level
flow from coarse to fine
flow from fine to coarse This is done in the higher level wrapping function
XParam
Model parameters
slope
slope of the valley sides
bottop
if true the river flows bottom to top, if false left to right
flip
if true the river flows right to left or top to bottom, if false left to right or bottom to top
true if test passed

memberdef.argsstring: (Param XParam, T maxslope)
memberdef.name: testboundaries

memberdef.argsstring: (Param XParam, T slope, int Dir, int Bound_type)
memberdef.name: RiverOnBoundary

memberdef.name: LakeAtRest

briefdescription.para: Test the lake at rest condition This function simulates the first predictive step and check whether the lake at rest is preserved otherwise it prints out to screen the cells (and neighbour) where the test fails.

detaileddescription.para:
The function inherits the adaptation set in XParam so needs to be rerun to accnout for the different scenarios:
uniform level
flow from coasrse to fine
flow from fine to coarse This is done in the higher level wrapping function
XParam
Model parameters
XModel
Model variables
true if test passed

iy

memberdef.name: Raintest

briefdescription.para: Test the rain input and mass conservation This function tests the mass conservation of the spacial injection (used to model rain on grid) The function creates its own model setup and mesh independantly to what the user inputs. This starts with a initial water level (zsnit=0.0 is dry) and runs for 0.1s before comparing results with zsnit=0.1 that is approx 20 steps.

detaileddescription.para:
!
zsnit
Initial water level
gpu
GPU device to use (or -1 for CPU)
alpha
Slope of the bathymetry in %
engine
Engine to use (0=non-hydrostatic, 1=hydrostatic)
true if test passed

memberdef.argsstring: (int gpu)
memberdef.name: Raintestinput

briefdescription.para: Test the rain input options This function tests the different inputs for rain forcing. This test is based on the paper Aureli2020, the 3 slopes test with regional rain. The experiment has been presented in Iwagaki1955. The first test compares a time varying rain input using a uniform time serie forcing and a time varying 2D field (with same value). The second test check the 3D rain forcing (comparing it to expected values).

detaileddescription.para:
!
gpu
GPU device to use (or -1 for CPU)
true if test passed

memberdef.argsstring: (int gpu, int dimf, T zinit)
memberdef.name: Raintestmap

briefdescription.para: Test the rain input options and return the flux at the bottom of the slope This function return the flux at the bottom of the 3 part slope for different types of rain forcings using the test case based on Iwagaki1955.

detaileddescription.para:
! \fnstdvector<float> Raintestmap(int gpu, int dimf, T zinit)
gpu
GPU device to use (or -1 for CPU)
dimf
Dimension of the rain forcing (1=uniform, 3=2
zinit
Initial water level
vector of flux at the bottom of the slope

memberdef.argsstring: (int gpu, int dimf, float Zsinit)
memberdef.name: Raintestmap< float >

memberdef.argsstring: (int gpu, int dimf, double Zsinit)
memberdef.name: Raintestmap< double >

briefdescription.para: Test the Initial and Continuous losses implementation This function tests the Initial Losses and Continuous Losses implementation a plain domain, under constant rain. The function creates its own model setup and mesh independantly to what the user inputs. This starts with a initial water level (zsinit=0.0 is dry) and runs for 1s comparing results every 0.1s (that is approx 20 steps)

detaileddescription.para:
!
zsinit
Initial water level
gpu
GPU device to use (or -1 for CPU)
alpha
Tolerance for the test (relative error)
true if test passed

memberdef.name: TestInstability

briefdescription.para: Test the stability of the model This function tests the stability of the model on a sloping domain with a small amount of water The function creates its own model setup and mesh independantly to what the user inputs. This starts with a initial water level (zsinit=0.0 is dry) and runs for 1s comparing results every 0.1s.

simplesect.para: 0 if test failed (i.e. unstable), 1 if test passed

memberdef.argsstring: (int gpu, T ref, int scenario)
memberdef.name: TestMultiBathyRough

briefdescription.para: Test the reading of multiple bathymetry and roughness files.

detaileddescription.para: This function creates bathy and roughtness files and tests their reading (and interpolation) The objectif is particularly to test multi bathy/roughness inputs and value/file input.

parameterdescription.para: GPU to use (-1 for CPU only)
Reference elevation for the bathymetry files
Scenario to test (0: R1 in the middle of the domain, 1: R1 covering the whole domain)

simplesect.para: true if test passed (i.e. the model runs without crashing and gives a reasonable result)

memberdef.argsstring: (int gpu, T ref, int scenario)
memberdef.name: TestFlexibleOutputTimes

briefdescription.para: Test the reading of flexible output times.

detaileddescription.para:
This function creates a case set-up with a param file, read it. It tests the reading and default values used for times outputs. It checks the vectors for time outputs.
gpu
GPU to use (-1 for CPU only)
ref
Reference elevation for the bathymetry files
scenario
Scenario to test (not used here but could be used to test different input cases)
true if test passed (i.e. the model runs without crashing and gives a reasonable result)

memberdef.argsstring: (Param XParam, Forcing< float > XForcing, Model< T > XModel, Model< T > XModel_g)
memberdef.name: TestFirsthalfstep

briefdescription.para: Test the first half step of the model This function tests the first half step of the model on a sloping domain with a small amount of water The function creates its own model setup and mesh independantly to what the user inputs. This starts with a initial water level (zsinit=0.0 is dry) and runs for 1s comparing results every 0.1s.

memberdef.argsstring: (Param XParam, Forcing< float > XForcing, Model< T > XModel, Model< T > XModel_g)
memberdef.name: Testzbinit

briefdescription.para: Test the zbinit option of the model This function tests the zbinit option of the model on a sloping domain with a small amount of water The function creates its own model setup and mesh independantly to what the user inputs. This starts with a initial water level (zsinit=0.0 is dry) and runs for 1s comparing results every 0.1s.

memberdef.argsstring: (Param XParam, Model< T > XModel, Model< T > XModel_g, bool bottop, bool flip, bool withaoi)
memberdef.name: TestAIObnd

briefdescription.para: Test the aoibnd option of the model This function tests the aoibnd option of the model on a valley domain with a small amount of water The function creates its own model setup and mesh independantly to what the user inputs. This starts with a initial water level (zsinit=0.0 is dry) and runs for 20s.

parameterdescription.para: true if the boundary condition to test is bottom/top, false for left/right
true if the boundary condition to test is top or right, false for bottom or left
true if the AOI is to be used, false otherwise

simplesect.para: 1 if the test passed (i.e. the model runs without crashing and gives a reasonable result), 0 otherwise

briefdescription.para: A simple kernel to add an offset to a vector This is used to test the pin memory allocation and transfer between CPU and GPU.

parameterdescription.para: Number of elements in the vector
Data type of the vector (float or double)

memberdef.argsstring: (Param XParam, Model< T > XModel, Model< T > XModel_g)
memberdef.name: TestPinMem

briefdescription.para: Test the pin memory allocation and transfer between CPU and GPU This function allocates a pinned memory array on the CPU, fills it with values, transfers it to the GPU, modifies it there, and transfers it back to the CPU. It then checks that the values have been correctly modified.

simplesect.para: 1 if the test passed (i.e. the values are as expected), 0 otherwise

parameterdescription.para: Model parameters (only used to set the mesh size)
true if the valley is oriented in the y direction (i.e. bottom/top boundaries), false if in the x direction (i.e. left/right boundaries)
true if the valley is oriented towards top or right, false if towards bottom or left

simplesect.para: A Forcing structure containing the bathymetry

This function is quite useful when checking for Lake-at-Rest states This function requires a preallocated output and a shuffle (right side term) CPU pointers to save the result of teh calculation.

Output array (right side term)
